footer.title: Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal Service Institute
footer.description: Carrying forward the 500-year-old legacy of Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal, dedicated to education, health, and environmental protection.
footer.videos: Randheer Ji Babal & Babal Parivar Video Documentary

ctaSection.title: Your Support, A Bright Future
ctaSection.description: Not trying is like accepting failure beforehand, while trying always keeps the possibility of winning alive.

hero.subtitle: Carrying forward the divine legacy. Dedicated to education, health, culture, and environmental protection.

legacy.founderSub: Disciple of Guru Jambhoji • Born 1513 AD
legacy.quote: "True worship of God is service to nature and humanity."
legacy.para1: Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal was the supreme disciple of Guru Jambhoji, the founder of the Bishnoi sect. Born in 1513 AD in Babalsar village, he dedicated his life to environmental protection, compassion for all living beings, and spiritual awakening.
legacy.para2: Today, Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan, under the leadership of Chairman Shri Ramesh Babal, is carrying forward this 500-year-old tradition through education, health, and tree plantation campaigns.

vidya.title: Vidya (Education & Development)
vidya.description: In line with objectives (7, 9, 10), we aim to spread education for boys, girls, and women, and operate schools, colleges, and hostels.

nirogi-kaya.title: Nirogi Kaya (Health & Medicine)
nirogi-kaya.description: Under objectives (8, 11), we provide medical facilities, health camps, and agricultural development initiatives for the upliftment of the poor and marginalized.

paryavaran.title: Paryavaran (Ecological Conservation)
paryavaran.description: In compliance with objective (5), we are committed to environmental and ecological conservation. We keep the tradition of 'Sir Sate Roonkh Rahe' alive.

sanskar.title: Sanskar & Culture
sanskar.description: Preservation and promotion of Bishnoi religion and Jambhani literature.

other.title: Other Public Welfare Work
other.description: Under objective (13), we are dedicated to public welfare through activities like cow service, bird service, and drinking water facilities.
other.tagline: Service to Man is Service to God

education.title: Education
education.description: Shaping the future of children through quality education and resources.

health.title: Health
health.description: Providing accessible health services and medical camps in rural areas.
health.tagline: First Happiness is a Healthy Body

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Reclaiming nature through afforestation and water conservation.

hero.quote: "Rooted in the timeless wisdom of Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal, we build bridges of hope for the needy."

leadership.title: Our Leadership
leadership.presQuote: "Our mission is to serve humanity with the same devotion that Sant Randheer Ji had for nature."
leadership.presRole: President, Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan
leadership.secQuote: "Our main goal is to sow the seeds of education and values within the society through the institute."
leadership.secRole: General Secretary, Sant Shree Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan (Basni Nikuba)

objectives.title: Objectives of the Organization
objectives.intro: The jurisdiction of the committee extends to the revenue limits of the entire state of Rajasthan. Our main objectives are as follows:
list: To propagate the philosophy and teachings of Lord Jambheshwar.
To undertake all activities related to the ideology and teachings of Shri Randhirji Babal, the supreme disciple of Lord Jambheshwar.
To initiate and organize a fair in the name of Shri Randhirji Babal.
To collect and publish the history and genealogy of the Babal gotra.
To work for environmental and ecological conservation.
To work for the education and development of boys, girls, women, and adults.
To work for the upliftment and development of the poor and economically/socially backward people.
To establish and operate schools, colleges, and universities.
To initiate and operate hostels and reading rooms for students.
To undertake activities related to education, health, medicine, and agricultural development.
To undertake all activities for the literature and development of the Bishnoi sect.
To undertake any other activities in the public interest.

structure.title: Formation of the Executive Committee
structure.intro: To run the work of the institute smoothly, a managing executive committee will be formed consisting of a total of 31 office bearers and members:

membership.title: Membership and Rules
membership.eligibilityText: Qualification: The member must be an adult, fully vegetarian, not hunting wildlife, and must have an unshakable belief in the principles of Lord Jambheshwar.
membership.note: Note: Rules for membership expulsion, general assembly, and meetings will be governed according to the 'Institute Constitution Manual'.

hero.subtitle: Explore our holistic approach to community upliftment, spanning education and healthcare to spiritual growth and environmental preservation.

items.description: Shri Jambheshwar Bhagwan (V.S. 1508 - 1593), founder of the Bishnoi sect and our supreme deity, who gave the immortal message of humanity and environmental protection through 29 principles.

items.title: Patvi Disciple & First Mahant
items.name: Sant Shri Randheer Ji Babal
items.description: Close disciple of Guru Jambhoji and the first Mahant of Mukam. Founded Padiyal village in V.S. 1542 and dedicated his entire life to religious preaching and public welfare.

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.intro1: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we use them. You should read this policy so you can understand what type of cookies we use, the information we collect using cookies and how that information is used.

section1.title: What are Cookies?
section1.p1: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used in order to make websites work, or work more efficiently, as well as to provide information to the owners of the site.

section2.title: How We Use Cookies
section2.p1: We use cookies for the following purposes:
items: Essential Cookies: These are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable core functionality such as page navigation and access to secure areas.
Analytics Cookies: These cookies help us to understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. This helps us to improve our services.

section3.title: Managing Cookies
section3.p1: Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. However, this may prevent you from taking full advantage of the website.

section4.title: Contact Us
section4.p1: If you have any questions about our use of cookies, please contact us:

section1.title: 1. Terms
section1.p1: By accessing the website at https://randheerseva.org, you are agreeing to be bound by these terms of service, all applicable laws and regulations, and agree that you are responsible for compliance with any applicable local laws.

section2.title: 2. Use License
section2.p1: Permission is granted to temporarily download one copy of the materials (information or software) on Sant Shri Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan's website for personal, non-commercial transitory viewing only. This is the grant of a license, not a transfer of title, and under this license you may not:
items: use the materials for any commercial purpose, or for any public display (commercial or non-commercial);
attempt to decompile or reverse engineer any software contained on the website;
remove any copyright or other proprietary notations from the materials; or
transfer the materials to another person or "mirror" the materials on any other server.

section3.title: 3. Disclaimer
section3.p1: The materials on Sant Shri Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan's website are provided on an 'as is' basis. We make no warranties, expressed or implied, and hereby disclaim and negate all other warranties including, without limitation, implied warranties or conditions of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement of intellectual property or other violation of rights.

section4.title: 4. Governing Law
section4.p1: These terms and conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Rajasthan, India and you irrevocably submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in that State or location.

section5.title: 5. Contact Us
section5.p1: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us:

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro1: Sant Shri Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how your personal information is collected, used, and disclosed by SSRJB Seva Sansthan.
privacyPolicy.intro2: This Privacy Policy applies to our website and its associated subdomains (collectively, our "Service"). By accessing or using our Service, you signify that you have read, understood, and agree to our collection, storage, use, and disclosure of your personal information as described in this Privacy Policy.

section1.title: 1. Information We Collect
section1.p1: We collect information you provide directly to us. For example, we collect information when you:
items: Fill out a contact form or volunteer application.
Subscribe to our newsletter or communications.
Communicate with us via third-party platforms.
section1.p2: The types of information we may collect include your name, email address, phone number, and any other information you choose to provide.

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.p1: We use the information we collect to:
items: Provide, maintain, and improve our services and initiatives.
Send you technical notices, updates, security alerts, and support messages.
Respond to your comments, questions, and requests.
Communicate with you about news, events, and campaigns.

section3.title: 3. Disclosure of Information
section3.p1: We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer your personally identifiable information to outside parties unless we have your permission or are required by law.

section4.title: 4. Security
section4.p1: We take reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction. However, no internet transmission is ever fully secure or error free.

section5.title: 5. Contact Us
section5.p1: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:
section5.contactInfo:
Sant Shri Randheer Ji Babal Seva Sansthan
HQ Shri Jambheshwar Bhagwan Mandir,
Fitkasni, District Jodhpur, Rajasthan

introduction.title: Guru Jambhoji's Patvi Disciple Randheer Ji Babal and Babal Genealogy
introduction.content: Guru Jambhoji was incarnated in Vikram Samvat 1508 and attained Mahaparinirvana on Mingsar Badi Navami in Vikram Samvat 1593. Throughout his life, Guru Jambhoji preached to people through his words and taught the right way to live. Randheer Ji Babal was a Patvi and Hazuri (close associate) disciple of Lord Jambheshwar and always stayed with him. Poet Sahabramji Rahad has written in his book Jambhsar that when Guru Jambhoji was about to become invisible, his disciples asked - 'Maharaj, what will happen to us? Who will be the master of the sect?' Then Guru Jambhoji gave different garbs to four saints and bestowed different seats (Gaddis).

chapters.title: Meeting the Guru and Initiation
chapters.content: Randheer Ji Babal was a Jat from the village of Babalsar. In V.S. 1541, a severe famine struck Marwar, and he along with his family was traveling to Malwa. On this journey, he came into contact with Guru Maharaj Shri, listened to his sermons, and subsequently got initiated into the Bishnoi sect. Randheer Ji Babal founded the village of Padiyal (Phalodi) in V.S. 1542. Later on, he and his family started living in Padiyal. From there, he began visiting Samrathal to listen to the teachings of Guru Jambhoji. Gradually, retiring from his social responsibilities, he settled permanently in Samrathal with the Guru. Randheer Ji Babal always stayed with his Guru to spread religious principles, teach the Guru's words to common people, impart knowledge, perform Havan and Puja, awaken them, and personally express reverence to his Guru through Sakhi recitals and Aartis.

chapters.title: The Garb Episode and Position of Mahant
chapters.content:
Guru Jambhoji presented different garbs to his four prime disciples:

"Redo Ji Kali Poshaka, Kiye Mahant Sir Par Kar Rakha.
Lal Poshaka Mahant Nyalo, Jambhaguru Aagya Mein Chalo.
Randheer Ji Bhagwe Ke Mahanta, Madi Deenhi Sab Mil Santa.
Chauthi Madi Shwet Poshaka, Aapne Paas Leevi Har Sakha."

In this way, the Guru bestowed the saffron (Bhagwan) garb to Randheer Ji, called him near, and said smilingly - "Randheer Ji, you are the master of Riddhi (prosperity). From today, you hold the authority over this place." The poet further says that the Jambh Peera made Mahant Randheera the master of the Mukam with his own hands. Randheer Ji Babal was a householder and had a family, but after coming under the shelter of Guru Jambhoji, he became a saint.

chapters.title: The First Aarti and Spiritual Thoughts
chapters.content: An Aarti composed by Randheer Ji related to Jambhoji is found, which is the first Aarti of Jambhani literature. From this Aarti, it is revealed that the Bishnoi sect has been going on since Satyuga. Guru Jambhoji at that time incarnated as Narasimha and salvaged his devotees and others. Here is the original Aarti composed by Randheer Ji Babal:
aarti: Aarti Kije Narsingh Kanwar Ki, Ved Vimal Yash Bhave Mere Swami Ji Ki..
Pehli Aarti Prahlad Ubaare, Hiranyakashipu Nakh Udar Bidare.
Doosri Aarti Bawan Sewa, Bali Ke Dware Padhare Hari Dewa.
Teesri Aarti Vaikunth Padhare, Sahastrabahu Ji Ke Karaj Saare.
Chauthi Aarti Asur Sanhare, Bhakt Vibhishan Lank Baithaye.
Panchvi Aarti Kans Pachhai, Gopiyan Gwal Sada Pratipale.
Tulsi Ke Paat Jo Ghat Ghat Heera, Hari Ke Charan Gun Gaavai Randheer.

chapters.title: Delhi Journey and Lodi Rulers
chapters.content: During the manifestation of Guru Jambhoji, the Lodi dynasty was ruling Delhi. Bahlol Lodi, Sikandar Lodi, and Ibrahim Lodi were the three major rulers of this dynasty. Among them, Guru Jambhoji came in contact with Sikandar Lodi. During Guru Jambhoji's journey to Delhi, his beloved disciple Randheer Ji Babal was with him. Once when Guru Jambhoji went to Delhi to get his disciples Hasam-Kasam tailors released, Randheer Ji Babal accompanied him. He was always ready to serve his Guru.

vanshavaliDetails.title: History of Babal Lineage
vanshavaliDetails.description: The Babal family has immense faith here, and everyone visits to pay their respects on Jeth Sudi Dashami.

lineage.name: Randheer Ji Babal
lineage.note: Initiated into the Bishnoi sect, first Mahant of Mukam temple. Founded the village of Padiyal in V.S. 1542.

lineage.name: Hapuji

wives.name: Heera Devi Khileran
wives.details: Daughter of Heeraji and granddaughter of Harkaji

lineage.note: Hapuji passed away on Kartik Badi Teej, Samvat 1612.

lineage.name: Manduji

wives.name: Gavri Devi Saran
wives.details: Daughter of Jaguji, granddaughter of Dedoji

wives.name: Antiya (Itiya) Godara
wives.details: Daughter of Premji, granddaughter of Ramuji

lineage.note: Manduji passed away on Kartik Sudi Satam, Samvat 1662. Manduji's wife Antiya committed Sati behind her son Nathoji on Samvat 1608 Bhadwa Sudi Aatham, Monday at 6 PM, who is known today as 'Mahasati'. She is revered on Bhadwa Sudi Aatham.

lineage.name: Laduji

wives.name: Ganwari Godari
wives.details: Daughter of Heeraji and granddaughter of Harkaji

lineage.note: Son of Manduji. He resided in Padiyal.

lineage.name: Lalo Ji

wives.name: Ganga Beniwal
wives.details: Daughter of Iroji and granddaughter of Mugloji

wives.name: Nauji Mahla
wives.details: Daughter of Dharmoji, granddaughter of Nimboji

lineage.note: Laloji founded the Fitkasni village on V.S. 1617 Jeth Sudi Pancham. Laloji passed away on Jeth Sudi Teej, V.S. 1677.

lineage.name: Ratnoji
lineage.note: Ratnoji's son Jaimal Ji gave his life in religious works; he became a martyr in Fitkasni village. He holds immense respect among the Babals. The lineage later continued through Jayo Ji, Jodha Ji, Aaso Ji, and Jagmal Ji.

lineage.name: Current Generation
lineage.note: Currently, the 16th/17th generations of the Randheer Ji Babal lineage are flourishing and engaged in the service of society and environment.

vanshavaliDetails.finalQuote: Currently, the 16th/17th generations of the Randheer Ji Babal lineage are flourishing.

khejarli.title: Khejarli Massacre
khejarli.description: "Bhado Sudi Dashami, V.S. 1787: Under the leadership of Amrita Devi Bishnoi, 363 brave Bishnois sacrificed their lives to protect the Khejri trees. In this event, 26 members of the Babal family also made their supreme sacrifice."
